content.description:
This is a Black Mountain mega-classic.  A gorgeous overhang with impeccable rock quality, wild gymnastic moves, an unforgettable topout... it's got it all.

The standing start begins in the middle of the wall, goes up and left, then heads back right with crazy, unlikely body English.  Then continue right to the baffling sloper topout.  A very memorable climb.
Start at chest height rail and climb up horizontal rails to a big left facing flake and mantle over.
content.location: When looking at the Tour boulder follow a faint path down from the right about 150 feet passing a large boulder on your left before reaching the Future Wall. This climb starts at rail at chest height on the right side of the boulder

content.description: Start on holds at head level and pull through big moves to left facing flake. The top out is on less positive holds but this is a truly great climb at the grade.
content.location: When looking at the Tour boulder follow a faint path down from the right about 150 feet passing a large boulder on your left before reaching the Future Wall.

content.description: Sit start in a horizontal cut below the overhanging block, moving up and left then finishing right of the arete.
content.location: On the trail between Boulder Basin and the Tour de France boulder.

content.description: Crouch start at base of large “refrigerator” block and scale up the feature using compression and footwork trickery. Secure a couple edges at the end of the over hang to top out up and left.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter as the top out is above a downhill drop.
content.location: Backside of the Tour de France Boulder.
